21st Century Skills, also known as Core Competencies or 21st Century Learning, include a range of skills and abilities that are necessary for thriving in the modern world. These skills are categorized into four main groups:

1. Communication:
- Listening actively
- Interpersonal communication
- Public speaking and presenting
- Media literacy

2. Collaboration:
- Teamwork/cooperation, including virtual collaboration with people from diverse backgrounds and cultures.
- Consensus building/decision-making 
- Adaptability/flexibility 

3. Critical Thinking & Problem Solving:
-Creativity / Innovation: Develop original ideas
-critical thinking (analyze/synthesize information)
-problem-solving/dealing with complex situations/tasks 
-digital problem-solving; technically literate,
-research skills - gather information from different sources then evaluate them.

4. Personal qualities/values applying ethics to decisions/actions/results.
-Self-direction/personal learningâ€”initiative/independent work/goal-setting",
-Leadership;
-displaying responsibility/accountability in varying scenarios;
-self-assessment/reflection;

In addition to these core competencies, we can also consider some more specific areas such as:

5 Digital Literacy including relevant digital tools/software/social media platforms

6 Global Awareness having an understanding/appreciation of diversity/multiculturalism/world issues/problems/environment 

7 Entrepreneurship/self-sustaining careers/business creation,

8 Financial/Fiscal Literacy considering personal finance/economics/budgets/taxes/consumer behavior/

Collectively these essential 21st-century capabilities will serve as tools allowing individuals/groups/resources/tools/models/resources/employers/workplaces/-to engage better together on local/globally based tasks/issues-to live lives enriched through life-long education research efforts/community involvement societal impacts,
